data.content:
verb
churns; churned; churning
to stir or mix something (such as water or mud) with force [+ obj]
The motorboats churned the water. - often + up
The horse's hooves churned up the sod. [no obj]
The water churned all around us.
[no obj] :to move in a circle :turn
The wheels/gears began to slowly churn.
[+ obj] :to make (butter) by stirring or shaking cream in a churn
He showed them how to churn butter.
[no obj] :to experience a lot of confused activity
My mind was churning as I tried to think of what to say.
Her emotions were churning inside her.
If your stomach churns or something churns your stomach, you feel sick from nervousness, disgust, etc.
Just thinking about the test made my stomach churn.
The violence in the movie churned my stomach.
churn out
[phrasal verb]
churn out (something) or churn (something) out informal + often disapproving :to produce (something, especially something of low quality) quickly as part of a continuous process
He churns out [=grinds out] a new novel every year.
the latest graduates churned out by the college
noun
plural churns
[count] :a container in which cream is stirred or shaken to make butter

Danh từ
máy đánh kem (để làm bơ)
thùng đựng sữa (ở nông trại hay để chuyên chở sữa)
Động từ
đánh lấy kem (để làm bơ); làm bơ
[up] khuấy tung lên
motor boats churning [up] the peaceful waters of the bay
thuyền máy khuấy tung nước yên tĩnh ở vùng vịnh
the earth had been churned by the wheels of the tractor
mặt đất bị bánh xe máy kéo cày tung lên
cuộn lên, quặn lên
the churning waters of a whirlpool
nước cuộn của một xoáy nước
his stomach churned with nausea
bụng anh ta quặn lên vì buồn nôn
churn something out
(khẩu ngữ) sản xuất ra hàng lọat (thường là hàng kém phẩm chất)
she churns out romantic novels
chị ta cho ra hàng loạt tiểu thuyết lãng mạn
